means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 蒂芬来源于中世纪希腊语女子名Tiffania,含义是“上帝+出现”(God+to appear)

sentence.Network_en: And it is their sorting procedure that has made the tiffin wales so famous.
sentence.Network_cn: 而这要归功于他们的分类流程才使得午餐递送如此出名.

在茶园 (Tiffin)，耳畔是现场爵士乐三重奏和钢琴乐韵，所以无论在此享用午餐、下午茶或甜品，都倍感闲适惬意。 咖啡厅 (Grand Caf…

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: apparently from dialect tiffing 'sipping', of unknown origin

auth_sentence.content: Senior's immense family had adopted him long ago and brought him tiffin and attended to his needs.

auth_sentence.content: Umpire Russell Tiffin upheld West Indies appeals for a catch to send a disbelieving Kallis back to the pavilion.

auth_sentence.content: Umpire Russell Tiffin rejected England's appeal but, on referral to third umpire Daryl Harper, the Windies captain was given out.
